3 Damion Jeanpiere Jr.

Position WR

Height 6-1

Weight 185

Class Senior

Hometown Kenner, La.

Highschool Archbishop Rummel

Bio

Stats

Historical

Biography

HONORS

2018

- All-Southland Second Team (Punt Returner)

- All-Southland Honorable Mention (Wide Receiver)

2017

- All-Southland Second Team

- Southland Offensive Player of the Week (9/11)

CAREER RANKINGS

- Second all-time in receiving yards with 2,324 yards

- Finished with 128 rec. (18.2 ypc) and 14 touchdown receptions

2018 Season (Senior): Started all 13 games at receiver, earning All-Southland honorable mention... led the Colonels with 850 yards receiving on 44 receptions, ranking 11th in the Southland at 65.4 yards per game... ranked 13th in the FCS with 19.32 yards per catch... had three receiving touchdowns... recorded three 100-yard games, including a season-high 143 yards on a seven receptions in playoff win vs. San Diego... grabbed four passes for 100 yards against McNeese... finished with three receptions for 143 yards and in win over UIW, highlighted by a 48-yard touchdown catch... also had a 12-yard touchdown catch in win over Sam Houston State... fell just shy of 100 yards at HBU with 96 on on seven receptions... had a reception in all 13 games, and had five games with 4 or more... also received All-Soutlhand Second Team honors as a punt returner, finishing with 82 yards on 12 returns with a long of 28.

2017 Season (Junior): Started all 12 games as the Colonels' No. 1 receiver... named All-Southland Second Team... racked up 770 yard receiving and four touchdowns on 40 receptions, ranking 16th in FCS in yards per catch (19.3)... ranked fifth in the SLC with 64.2 yards per game... posted two 100-yard games... had three receptions for 145 yards and two touchdowns in win over McNeese. Recorded 62- and 77-yard touchdown catches against the Cowboys... named SLC Player of the Week for his performance at Texas A&M, finishing with a career high 174 yards on five receptions... scored on a 57-yard catch at Sam Houston State... also had a 3-yard TD reception at Stephen F. Austin... had three or more receptions in nine games... rushed twice for 18 yards... scored on a 7-yard rush at Southeastern Louisiana.

2016 Season (Sophomore): Played in all 11 games, starting at wide receiver... was second on the team in receiving yards, finishing with 505 on 37 receptions... hauled in six touchdown catches... averaged 13.6 yards per reception... put together a season best 94 yards on four grabs against McNeese, highlighted by a 51-yard reception... had a TD catch in six different games, including one in overtime against SFA... recorded a reception in all but one game.

2015 Season (Freshman): Played in the first five games including one start before missing the rest of the season with an injury… hauled in seven catches for 199 yards and a touchdown, averaging 28.4 yards per catch… recorded his first career reception against McNeese… went on to a breakout performance against the Cowboys with five receptions for 112 yards and a touchdown… his touchdown came on a 52-yard grab… had two receptions for 87 yards at Stephen F. Austin before suffering a season-ending injury.

At Rummel: Was on the football team and ran track for the Raiders... played for head coach and Nicholls alum Jay Roth... team captured state titles in 2012 and 2013.

Personal: Born Dec. 8, 1996... parents are Damion and Desiree Jeanpiere... has two younger sisters, Destinee and Daeja... majoring in petroleum engineering.
